1.content:
“Mew.”

“W-What?”

“Mew.”

You slowly open your eyes, trying to figure out what that sound was that dragged you out of your sleep. Seeing that it was... a Mew.

It’s face, right in front of yours and blinking a couple of times back at you. Several blinks over and over.

“Mew.”

You quickly scurry back as you look at the Legendary that was in front of you. You can’t believe it! It was Mew, the Pokemon Mew! The legendary Mew! It looked at you as you sat on the ground.

When you slept on the outskirts of town today, no bit of you thought that you would actually be found on a legendary. You just wanted some rest on the grass.

“Why... hello there Mew!” You say excitedly and with a smile.

Which Mew loved. “Mew!!” She said as she flew over and around your head. Taking several laps as it giggled.

“What are you doing here? You woke me up.” You say with a laugh as you can’t really be mad.

It didn’t answer, instead it flew high into the air, and then down at you. Your eyes open as you see it ram into your chest. Just enough to send you down on your back. You look down and see it laying on your chest and giggled.

“Mew! Mew!”

“Right... i’ve heard that you are playful. Guess you are.” You say as it flew off, only for a second as it then went under your shirt. “H-Hey! Mew cut that out!” You say with a laugh as it flew out and laughed itself. “You really are playful, just messing with a human like that.”

“Mew.” It said simply as it flew down to you, over your head as you feel it’s small feet on your head. Suddenly it kicked your hair around, making it wild as you laugh.

“Okay go ahead.” You say as it messed up your hair even more. So for a long time you were gonna have bed hair, just great.

Mew eventually got off, flying right in front of you as it turned around. Turning around and pointing it’s tail to your face.

Playfully, she wagged it in front of your face and tickled you.

“Hehe, Mew! Hehehe! Mew seriously!” You say as Mew laughs itself. It was probably laughing as much as you were. You know you could probably just hit the tail away, but clearly it was having fun.

You let it have fun until it pulled away. Looking to the sky. “Man what time is it? I did take a long nap didn’t I?” You say as you pull out your Pokenav. Pulling it and looking at the time. Only for Mew to come back down and land on your lap. Sitting there in a very cute manner.

“Okay Mew, say cheese!” You say as you get the camera and go in for a Selfie. “Or uh... Say Mew I guess...”

“Mew!” it said back, as you took the photo. There you go, proof that you met Mew. You don’t want to risk and try to capture it at the moment. You two were getting along and lets face it... Mew would be far too powerful for any trainer you know.

“Anyway, I guess I got to go Mew. It was-”

“Mew!” it said as it flew up high. High above you and looking at you. You could tell it had anticipation, and you were gonna deduct what it wanted.

“One more? Sure... go ahead. One more.” You say as she it laughs.

Mew took it’s time thinking about it, until finally it got what it wanted to do. Smiling it flew right in front of your face, and suddenly... it’s eyes glowed.

It’s using a move, you didn’t expect it but you guess it was. You wait to see what was happening, when suddenly you realised something. Was... Mew flying up.

She was above your head line, far above it. It kept going up. You were really confused, and it grew even more as you could feel the grass under you... get bigger.

You think about it for a long while, until you suddenly realise something. Looking at the tree closet to you, it was bigger than it should be. Looking back to Mew, she was far above you and the grass was bigger than it should be.

“Mew, are you shrinking me!” You say as it didn’t give a reaction. Instead you just went down and down, until one grass blade was enough for your entire hand to rest on. You stand up, not making much of a difference as you were now shrunk!

Mew’s eyes stopped glowing, as it flew down to you. Doing a loop and looking. When suddenly it giggled.

“M-Mew, this isn’t fun! I-” You trailed off, as you see Mew get closer. It was like a Dynamax version of itself, much bigger and much more powerful. You fall onto your rear as it gets closer, it’s nose almost knocking you at this point as you can’t believe the size difference.
 Finally it flew up into the air. Far into the air as you could see it turn around.

“M-Mew. Where are you-”

Mew started to fly away, not before looking back at you and saying something. Not what Pokemon say, not her name. But words, and more than that a challenge.

“Come find me!”

And with that, Mew flew into the air. You could only watch as the giant Pokemon flew far into the air. As far and high it could go, until the giant Pokemon was out of sight, and you were left... by yourself.

In a giant new world.

*

Okay, so I left it blank for the people who want to add and customise the story their way. If you write the next chapter. Make sure to detail.

:Which Region you are in.
:Which town you are near.
:If you are a trainer or not
:If you are a trainer, at least one of your Pokemon.
1.title: Shrunk By Mew

choices: You decided to chase after Mew!
You decided to try and get back to town to look for help!
Before you could move, a Pokemon came out!
Suddenly, someone passed by. Get their attention!
11.content:
This was unreal, and yet it somehow was: you had been woken up by a playful - and almost all powerful - legendary who had put you through a series of silly games.

You didn't mind at first, since there was no real harm in letting said legendary in have some fun with you for a bit while also entertaining you, but things had gone south when Mew's playfulness turned into mischief and she shrunk you down to a pathetically small stature. You were barely bigger than the paw of an Eevee at this size!

And, if that wasn't enough, the mysterious move Mew had used to shrink you had also managed to turn a simple patch of grass into a thick forest, leaving you lost in the middle of it, so close and yet so far from Olivine City, in Johto.

So, basically, you were screwed, no matter how you looked at the situation.

Feeling your legs trembling, you slowly sat down on the ground, pondering your next course of action.

What you had to do was clear: you had to find Mew and get her to give you back your size. After all, she was the one telling you to find her, no? The only question now was, how could you find Mew, who took off in a random direction? It would be already much if you managed to get out of here.

You groaned to yourself, thinking that the pesky legend was probably laughing while thinking about you now. Did she think of this as some game? Because you weren't enjoying yourself.

"Ugh..." you muttered, putting a hand over your head while looking down, trying to figure a way out of this mess.

Obviously, there wasn't much you could do while like this, but you couldn't stay like this, either.

You glanced at the sky, noting that the sun was about to set. If you had to do something, you had to move before night fell.

But what...

Any other thoughts you had suddenly vanished as an idea sprang in your mind. You still had your PokeNav! You could dial someone and ask them to come to your aid!

Mentally thanking Mew for at least shrinking your belongings along with you, you picked out the tool that was going to save you and searched for someone to call, hoping that they would believe you and not just laugh at your situation or even call you crazy.

You eventually picked a number and the PokeNav began dialing, but the result was unsatisfying: voicemail.

"Darn..." you mumbled as you quickly dialed someone else, getting the same result, the same result you got for about three other times before finally giving up in frustration and putting your PokeNav back in your pocket.

Great. What now?

You were completely alone. You didn't even have a Pokemon that could help you out in this dire situation; you briefly wondered if they would have shrunken along with you if you happened to have pokeballs on you at the time it happened.

You sat there for about five more minutes, surrounded by grass and enveloped in quiet. Then, you stood up.

Whatever happened next, you decided to cross that bridge when you came to it; right now, you had to at least get out of here.

So, remembering which direction you came from, you began a run through the towering blades of grass.

Surprisingly, it didn't take you that long to get out of the 'woods'; you were actually able to find your way out in about five minutes, which was good.

Once you got out, found yourself by the road.

You immediately turned to head for Olivine City, but a thought halted you before you could take your first step: Mew had gone in the exact opposite direction.

Perhaps, you should have tried to go after her... you shook your head. The pink legendary was probably long gone by now!... But what if she wasn't?

You remembered the last and only words she said you before taking off, 'Come find me'. Perhaps, that last game she wanted to play was a more wicked version of hide and seek? Perhaps Mew was just hiding close by and you had to find her?

But if she wasn't, then you were just going to waste precious time and possibly stumble into some Pokemon or person, and it could end badly either way: you could get eaten by the former, crushed underfoot by the latter if you weren't careful enough.

The thought alone made you shudder.

You stood there by the road for a long while, trying to decide whether you should go find Mew or go to the city and get someone to help you.

In the end, after a long hesitation, you made a choice and hoped you didn't end up regretting it.
11.title: Lost and helpless

choices: You go to the house
You are lucky and someone opens the door!
That trainer for before is coming! Maybe she can open it for you!
112.content:
Despite how much you wanted to go and chase after Mew, you knew you could not do it on your own. you were far too small to even dream about keeping up with her speed, not to mention she could fly! No if you wanted to get your height back, you were going to have to rely on someone else.

But who... well you were about to know, cause you were moving into Olivine City.

You make your way over, hearing the beach move as you know you need to go. You couldn’t see much from your perspective, except for the giant towering lighthouse you can see.

You need to get close, but you know... it will take forever. No point waiting though, cause you need to go.

-

And after a couple of hours, you got into town! You got into the city, breathing hard and tired. After all, you were barely a couple of inches tall, and a small stroll was like a marathon to you.

Still you were in town, and you were moving in. The sun was going down, so you really should get someone’s attention before the dark comes. Your home was on the other side of town, so that was away. You were too small to get there.

You could go to the Pokecenter. Now you never had to heal your own Pokemon, because you don’t have any. However you have talked to Nurse Joy, and have bonded with her. You doubt she actually remembers you due to how much people she meets, but you know she is nice.

While you walk around some more, you hear...

“Chikorita!” A voice said as you instantly hid. You were out in the open, as you could do nothing at the point no matter how much you want. It would take a solid fifteen seconds to hide.

Being small is terrible.

You watch as a giant Pokemon come into view, and it was the grass starter. The Pokemon didn’t stop you though, cause instead it just kept running. You watch it leave your view, and then you see a giant girl chasing after the Pokemon. With brown hair and a big white hat. A red and blue coulour scheme.

“Chikorita! Calm down!” She yelled for a long while chasing her. She was chasing her Pokemon and left quickly as you breathed a sigh of relief.

You did not deny that... she was giant. The giant girl, didn’t look that old but seemed so big to you. You need to get someone’s attention.

You walk around some more, avoiding giant steps as you remember this street. You could go to the Pokemon Center, but... you could also go to the gym.

It wasn’t that far as well, in fact the same distance. it may sound crazy, but you need to feel safe.

You are having a bit of a mini heart attack at the moment. Being so small, and everything towering over you, you need someone you can feel safe with.

Funnily enough, that might by the Johto Gym Leader Jasmine. Now you don’t know her personally, as you have never been in that kind of lifestyle. What you have heard about her though makes her sound kind, gentle and perfect.

Getting her attention might be what you want. Plus as a Gym Leader, she has connections and powerful Pokemon! She can help you!

So that was your plan, to the Gym. You go to walk and suddenly realise you were going the same direction of the giant trainer and the Pokemon.

You move and go through, of course having trouble because even though it is one block around, that is far too much for you. You just know you will feel tired when you get to the gym.

And tired you did feel, very tired to the point where you wanted to collapse.

And you were not even at the gym at the moment. You barely cross the street!

-

You lay down, tired and on the outside of the Gym. That was far too taxing for you. Even worse, it seemed, because you did have to avoid and dodge some giants and giantesses that were around you. You did not want to be found by just a random person.

You have rethought your plan and actually have been looking forward to meeting Jasmine. She sounded perfect, and she was cute. A blessing in disguise maybe... maybe not.

You can only imagine where Mew would be at this point. She just shrunk you and left, and she clearly wants you to follow and play.

Would she have gone that far? If you remember the books correctly, Mew has been rumored to know every move. Which raises more problems clearly. If she knows Teleport.... or Extreme Speed.

Oh that was not something you wanted. How long are you gonna stay small?

You get up onto your feet, and you plan to move, however you stop when you realise a problem. You were... stuck outside.

The sun basically down as you move around. It was not like the gym was closed, as you can see lights inside. The problem is... the door is a slide.

It feels weight on the pressure on the floor, and it opens up in response.

As for weight, well you don’t have that all.

“Come on!” You yell, as no one was near you. You jump and try to make the door open, if only for a second.

It wasn’t going to, and you were stuck outside.

What are you going to do? You can’t get into the gym by yourself, you are far too small to make weight.

Plus the Pokecenter is far too away now. Looking around... you spot a home not so far away with a slightly open window.

It may be degrading, but you might have to go and live in that house for the night. You won’t get spotted by whoever lives in there.

So maybe... you have to live under giants.
112.title: Back In Olivine City

choices: You waited for Leaf to leave, then tried to get Jasmine's attention
You followed Leaf, deciding to get her attention
Chikorita spotted you while passing by!
1123.content:
Staying in someone's house, even if only for one night and because you were in desperate need, felt wrong. After all, if anyone living in there spotted you, there was no telling what kind of punishment they would have inflicted upon you, the highest chances being you getting simply tossed back out or, worse, stepped on, which could perfectly happen even if whoever lived in the house remained unaware.

Still... you needed a shelter for the night.

So, swallowing your fear, you slowly took a couple steps away from the gym and towards the house, but something held you back: a girl, who you recognized as the person you saw before, was running towards the gym, her Chikorita running beside her.

"We can still make it." you heard her say in a low tone,
"Chika!" the Pokemon replied.

You felt your heart swelling. The girl was heading your way... she could open the door of the gym for you!... Just then, you recalled where you were.

The giantess could open the door for you alright... if you managed to not get stepped on by her!

The moment you realized this, the shoe of the girl was already hovering above you, crafting a huge shadow; hastily, you jumped out of the way as the large foot came crashing next to you, lingering for a moment before it disappeared as the door automatically opened.

Quickly, you stood back up and, while the door was closing back up, you hastily slid inside. Being tiny did have some advantages, after all.

Once inside, the door closed back up behind you, trapping you inside until someone came to open the door again, but you were fine with it: you planned to get someone's attention, possibly the gym leader Jasmine.

And speaking of Jasmine...

"I'm sorry, I'm late,"

You noted the girl from before apologizing to another girl. A stunningly beautiful girl: Jasmine, the steel-type gym leader, who was just standing in front of the other girl, offering a feeble smile.

"My Chikorita ran off and I had to get it back. I'm sorry." the other girl spoke. You noted how quiet she was. When you previously 'met' her, you could hear her voice loud and clear as she called out to her Pokemon to stop; now, you could barely even hear her.

"Um... don't worry, that's alright." Jasmine replied, blushing a bit. Her tone was just slightly higher than the other girl's and, geez, between these two ladies, you could barely hear a word. Good thing your reduced state made everything sound louder.
"We can have our match now, if you're, um, up for it. I don't mind." Jasmine finished.

The other girl, whose name was still unclear to you, smiled.

"Thanks." she said gratefully, only causing Jasmine's blush to gain even more ground on her face.

So, apparently, these two were going to have a gym battle.

Without even having to think twice, you stood aside and sat by a wall: there was no way you could get the attention of one of the two giantesses while they fought, and you didn't want to be anywhere near the battlefield when you were this vulnerable.

Still, watching giant Pokemon fight... that could be entertaining. Since you couldn't get their attention right now, you might as well watch.

You watched as both trainer and leader walked on opposite sides of the battlefield.

"So, um, since you're the challenger, you get the first move." Jasmine instructed.

The other just nodded her head to signal that she had understood, reaching in her bag to grab a Pokeball.

However, before she could toss it...

"Chiko!" the green Pokemon beside the girl chimed, causing her to halt.

"You want to go first, don't you?" she asked quietly, getting a confident nod from her Pokemon,
"Okay then. You're up, Chikorita,"

With a happy cry, Chikorita ran to the field.

You rose an eyebrow. A grass-type against a certain steel-type? You were no trainer, but even you knew that such fight was uneven. This girl must have been a newbie.

"Okay, then," Jasmine said, tossing a Pokeball,
"Magnemite, come on out, please,"

The Pokemon Jasmine called popped out and cried its name.

Then, the battle began.

--

For the next hour, you just watched the two trainers giving silent commands and their Pokemon obeying, clashing with each other in an admittedly pretty good fight.

Even if the unknown girl at been at a disadvantage before, she fought like an expert trainer.

Unexpectedly, her Chikorita took down Jasmine's Magnemite, and put up a good fight against her Magneton as well before the green Pokemon was called back by her trainer and was switched with a Ninetales.

From your point of view, the Pokemon looked magnificent, majestic even. And, expectedly, it took down Jasmine's Magneton in no time.

However, despite the type advantage, Ninetales stood no chance against Jasmine's strongest Pokemon: Steelix. The steel behemoth only used one Earthquake to knock out the poor vulpine while also shaking the whole gym.

You blessed your decision to stay aside.

As she returned her Ninetales, the other trainer smirked, though you couldn't see it.

"Blastoise," she called, tossing her Pokeball; a large, blue, bipedal turtle came out,

"Blastoise!" it cried its name, nearly deafening you.

"Hydro Pump, go," the trainer said. Her Pokemon obeyed without hesitation and pointed the two cannons in its shell towards Steelix.

"Steelix, dodge!" Jasmine yelled, worried for her Pokemon. This was the very first time you heard her voice so loud, and it was as beautiful as Jasmine herself was.

Sadly, as fast as Steelix was, it still got hit by Hydro Pump and got sent flying into a wall by the sheer force of the water; it didn't get up after that.

"Oh no..." Jasmine mumbled, rushing to her Pokemon to check if it was already, before returning Steelix to its Pokeball; then, she turned to the girl with a smile,
"Well, um... looks like you win," she said.

"Yeah." the other replied, her Chikorita jumping around in elation, happy for her trainer's latest victory.

Said trainer returned her Blastoise and approached Jasmine, who held out a gym badge.

You also got up, deciding that this was a great moment to try and get the attention of one of them.

"It's been, um, a great battle," Jasmine admitted with a small blush,
"So here's the Mineral Badge."

The other girl smiled.

"Thanks." she said, accepting the prize and storing it away, before saying,
"Guess I'll be going now."

Jasmine nodded.

"I hope to see you again, Leaf," she said, before smiling and blushing again,
"I look forward to a rematch."

You halted. 'Leaf'? Was that the name of the trainer of Chikorita?

Suddenly, realization dawned on you, while the two giantesses shook hands: this 'Leaf' was a traveling trainer, so if you could get her attention, you could convince her to help you find Mew during her journey!

However, you were a bit unsure.

After all, you didn't know if she'd be willing to help you out, and were far more sure about Jasmine to help you.

As you tried to decide, you noted the two titanesses finally parting ways as Leaf began walking away.

Whatever you had to do, whoever you had to pick, you had to do it quickly: Leaf was leaving!
1123.title: Quiet battle

choices: Climb up Jasmine
Climb up Skyla
Climb up Flannery
11231.content:
You decided to try and get Jasmine's attention, surly she could help you find that Mew. After Leaf left the gym, Jasmine let out a sigh of relief.

"*Sigh* That's the last one." Jasmine said. "Now I can go join my friends on vacation!" You didn't know that Jasmine had was planning to go on vacation. Then again, it was summer and now you wondered who her friend were. Your questioned was answered as you heard the door open as two girls walked in. One of them had fiery red hair and eyes, she wore a black shirt that was tied up in the front and under it was a red tube bra with a picture of a flame. She wore very baggy teal jeans that have three red knots on the bottom of each leg. Her jeans were held up by some sort of white cloth that had some sort of detail on one of the ends.

The other girl had reddish brown hair and blue eyes, Her hair was tied up by one pastel teal hair clip that resembled a flower. She wore a pastel teal skintight suit and light blue gloves. The suit didn't cover her whole body as it exposes her belly. Just like her suit and flower accessory, she wore pastel teal shorts that expose her legs up towards her pelvis. She had straps that bucked her on the front and some that leaded to her thighs. She had a light blue holster on her right leg which match the color of her gloves, straps, and the base of her boots. The top of the boots were more of a teal color.

You knew seen these girls before, it was Flannery and Skyla! You didn't know that Jasmine knew Hoenn's Fire-type Gym Leader and Sinnoh's Air-type Gym Leader.

"Jasmine! I'm so happy to see you again!" Skyla said as she went over to Jasmine to hug her.

"I'm so happy to see you too Skyla!" Jasmine said, hugging her back.

"So Jasmine, ready to go?" Flannery asked.

"Almost, let me get my bag from my room." Jasmine answered. "You don't mind waiting a bit?"

"Ehh, take your time. We'll wait by the bleachers." Flannery said.

You didn't have enough time, you were gonna have to join them in their vacation. You started ran towards the three girls. You saw Flannery and Skyla walking towards you, unaware that you were in their path. You dodged and weaved your way past the girl's gigantic feet and somehow made it unscratched. As soon as You made it passed them, Jasmine was already gone to get her bag. you decided to wait for her and jump on her bag.


5 minute later.....


You waited for Jasmine to come back and you gained back a bit of your stamina. You then heard the sound of footsteps and rolling wheels. You were happy to see that Jasmine founder her bag. Her bag matched her dress and had a cute little Magnemite key-chain.

"Sorry about the wait!" Jasmine apologized to Flannery and Skyla.

"It's fine Jasmine." Skyla said "Now we can go to the hotel!" You quickly grabbed onto the suitcase's key-chain as it passed by you. You were able to open the bag enough that you were able to slip inside. Once inside, you landed on some of her cloths. You thought this was good time to take a nap. You got into a comfortable position and went to sleep.


A few hours later......

You woke up, still in the suitcase. You stretched your arms and gave out a yawn. You had know idea what time it was nor where were you outside the suitcase, so you went to the bags opening from before and peeked outside.

Well, it wasn't a hotel, but it was a room of sorts. It resembled a small house with stairs leading to the second floor, the room had also a kitchen from where you were located. When you climbed out, you saw that the suitcases were leaning on the wall. Flannery's, from what you guessed, had a flames on it and a Torkoal key-chain. Skyla had a Sky theme on her suitcase and a Swana key-chain.

You turned around to see Jasmine, Skyla, and Flannery on the couch together, eating popcorn and watching a movie. The movie had Pokemon talking in English. You didn't know what the movie was about and you didn't have time, at the same time, you were getting a bit hungry. You saw that Skyla was holding a bowl of popcorn for the others to share.

You approached the couch they were seated at and shouted at them.

"Hey! Jasmine! Flannery! Skyla! Down Here! Help!" You shouted at them, but it was no use, they had no reaction fro your screaming. The only thing to do now is to go for some skin contact. You saw that Flannery was still wearing her jeans, which would make the climb easier. Not that it would matter, but you were confident with your climbing skills and could try to climb up Jasmine or Skyla. You were still hungry and thought that maybe you could grab on popcorn kernel from them.

Who do you go for?

A: Climb up Jasmine and try to get her attention.

B: Climb up Skyla and try and get her attention. (You then come to a choice between to continue climbing Skyla or Enter the popcorn bowl. Choosing the bowl will lead to an unaware vore route that you "may" get eaten by Jasmine, Skyla, or Flannery. Of course for the unaware vore route their would be chose to where they hear you and don't get eaten and one to where you are eaten, but don't die. I know the rules say "No choice chapters." I'll try to make it as long as possible.)

C:Climb up Flannery and try and get her attention.
11231.title: Vacation with Friends!

choices: Yell and get her attention
Try to make her feel you on her skin
Wait for her to sleep on the bed, and move then!
11232.content:
As the two titaness girls began to spread and separate each other, you look left and right seeing them go. You were gonna have to make your choice, stay with Jasmine or go with this Leaf!

Feeling pressured, you didn’t have time to really think about it... as you just had to go! Your eyes open as you turn right, running to the trainer and not the gym leader.

You run as fast as you can to catch up to this giant girl. Luckily she was waving goodbye and slowing her pace, which let you easily move and jump on.

Leaping over onto her sneaker as you hugged the shoelaces. You held for a long while, making sure you were safe and not going to be thrown around randomly.

She walked for a long while, leaving you as you see her move around and go over to the door. Opening it up when it featured her weight, and then she left. Every step that she took, sent you for a wide as you just kept grabbing.

Thinking about it for a long while, you realise this might be the better options. Sure, there was a lot of evidence why staying with Jasmine was the better option, but this girl... her Pokemon was stronger.

She had a Blastoise! And she bet Jasmine with her Pokemon. She was a trainer, so she was a traveller and... if anyone can help you not only find Mew, but also get your height back it might be her.

Granted, you don’t know anything about Leaf, except for the fact that she was a trainer, and she was... well a bit pretty.

Jasmine, pretty as well wouldn’t have the power to leave. She was a Gym Leader and had responsibilities, so this was the better option. At least that’s what you think.

On the other side, Leaf was walking looking at her newly gotten badge, That made fourteen. Fourteen badges she has. Eight from Kanto and now Six from Johto. Granted because of her badges, these Pokemon battles have never been easy, but they were fun and she loved them.

While most people are out to be the very best, Leaf was more out there for the adventure. When she gets the 8 from Johto, she plans to go to the other regions and get the Gym Leader badges there. After all she had to keep it up like her friends Red and Blue. Blue, who became a Gym Leader, and Red... who just kind of disappeared from the face of the earth.

As she walked she put the badge in her Johto case and smiled. Putting it near her Kanto badge case in her bag. She was glad Blastoise was able to finish it up, but she would be lying if she was happy that she had to rely on her Pokemon. She has been with Blastoise since it was a Squirtle, so of course the Pokemon was strong.

Chikorita was the starter she got when she came to Johto, and well... she was a fighter. The amount of times Leaf had to chase that Pokemon to keep it in line was a bit crazy, but she was strong. Sadly, not strong enough.

Still, she was glad to have her in her team. Looking around at the sky, it was getting dark. Stay a night at the Pokecenter, and then continue her journey.

She picked up the pace, as you hugged the foot even more. How fast was this girl going, so fast as you were gonna get hurt if you let go. You did move away from her shoelaces, and climb up to her baggy sock. Much easier to get a hold on as she walks. You just hug on for dear life, knowing this was gonna be your goal.

You see her walk in the direction of the Pokecenter, and pretty quickly she was there. Something that was a bit mind boggling as it would of taken you quite the journey, but for Leaf... she was there.

She walked in, and this was the first time you really grasped your size.

So many people, inside of the Pokecenter. Everyone of them towered over you, to the point where you did not want to move.

Even worse, there was some Pokemon scattered around, closer to seeing you. A Corsola not so far away but it’s female trainer. A towering young boy feeding his Rattata and Ratticate, both Pokemon having the power to eat you.

Thankfully Leaf didn’t pay them any mind as she walked up close. You were facing a counter, but Leaf was facing Nurse Joy.

“Hello, i’d like to rent a room.” Leaf said as you heard the voice of Nurse Joy.

“Understood, now are you going to want a living room, or a Pokemon room.” She said as Leaf knew the difference. Wasn’t the first Pokecenter she stayed at. A living room is just for her, simply to sleep and is the size for a human. While a Pokemon room is a lot more spacice, to accomidated for Pokemon. A lot more expensive though.”

“No, just a living room. Actually, if you can heal them as well, that would be great!” She smiled and sure enough, her Pokemon got healed.

You hear the chime and the room number that Leaf got, as she started to walk. You still hugging the sock of the girl as she walked down the halls. Away from all the giant people you ran the risk of being found by.

Leaf got to her door, twisting the key and pushing her way through. She pushed her way through and went into the room. A smile on her face as she was going to have a good night.

While you also dispatched from the sock, taking a bit of a break as you were now in her room.

All you have to do now is get her attention, should be simple enough. All you got to do is _________
11232.title: Hanging Onto Leaf

choices: Leaf began undressing as she got ready for the night
Leaf wanted to ask a few more questions
112321.content:
Pondering how to get Leaf's attention, you decided to just try to call out to her and hope she was going to hear you despite your diminished height... perhaps you should get a little closer though.

Nodding to no one in particular, you began making your way to the giantess while she finally halted by the bed; Chikorita hopped on without even thinking and laid down, moaning,

"Chiko..."

In the meantime, Leaf took off her backpack and placed it by the bed, before she silently stretched, tired after her battle with Jasmine. She removed her hat, placing next to Chikorita.

The trainer then went to lay on the bed, but halted in her tracks as she heard a faint noise.

Listening close, she could hear it again, over and over; and the more she listened, the more she figured out that it was someone's voice, calling out her name, but it was very distant.

On the floor behind her, you called one more time,

"Leaf!"

And, finally, the teen giantess turned around, but didn't look down right away, instead shooting silent glances around the room to locate whoever was calling her.

"Down here!" you yelled again.

Seemingly, the giantess heard you, because she glanced down, spotting you by her shoe.

Aside from a slightly surprised look on her face, Leaf had literally no reaction to her discovery of a small man no taller than the peak of her shoes.

You, on the other hand, were quite impressed by the towering height of the giantess and, for a moment, you nearly forgot why you were here, but you quickly found your composure and spoke,

"Uh, h-hi!" you said with a wave,
"You're... Leaf, right?"

Leaf remained unmoving for a couple moments more, before she slowly made a move.

You watched a the brunette bent her legs, making her less towering but still quite big; her hand found her way to you as you were picked up by Leaf, who then stood back up, holding you between her fingers, not saying a word, although there was an inquisitive stare in her eyes.

You gulped.

"Um... h-hi," you repeated, not knowing how else you could strike a conversation with a nearly-mute giantess,
"I-I'm sure you have a lot of questions, so let me explain please,"

She still said nothing, but moved her free hand, gesturing that your request was granted.

"Um... so, first things first, I'm here because... well, because I saw you back at Jasmine's gym," you admitted. Leaf rose an eyebrow; on the bed, Chikorita kept napping, blissfully unaware of what was happening.
"I was headed there because I wanted to get Jasmine's help, but then I ended up watching your match with her... speaking of which, you did pretty good out there!"

Leaf didn't show the slightest hint of a smile at your compliment, so you decided to go on,

"... So, after you finished, I thought I'd follow you, hoping that... don't mind the nerve, please... hoping that maybe you could help me!" you finished.

Leaf tilted her head to a side, letting her hair cascade down, still wearing an inquisitive expression, though it was more one of curiosity than one of suspicion now.

"Uh... oh, right, I missed the most important part," you said, proceeding to explain,
"You see, I'm so tiny because of an odd... 'experience' I had today..."

And so, you began explaining everything, from how you were woken up by Mew, to how she played with you, finishing with said legendary shrinking you to this size before taking off, challenging you to go and find her in before leaving, gone to an unknown destination, and that was why you followed Leaf, hoping she could lend a hand and help you find Mew.

At the end of your tale, Leaf looked a little skeptical.

You gulped - didn't she believe you?

"I, uh... I promise that everything I said is true, I don't know how I could-" you trailed off, remembering something,
"Wait, I actually do! Hold on..." you said, digging in your pocket to retrieve your PokeNav. Who knew those pictures you took of Mew would help this much?

Once you found the photo you were looking for on your device, you offered it to Leaf,

"Here..." you said, before realizing how stupid this was. Your PokeNav was probably nothing more that a grain of sand to Leaf.
"Uh... I don't know if you can see it..." you muttered.

Leaf said nothing. Instead, she moved two fingers over, slowly and carefully picking the device from your hand. Sadly, even with how careful she was being, your PokeNav was far too small to be handed by someone so big. The result was that it got crushed the moment Leaf moved her hand and, surprised, let go of the pieces, which fell to the floor while Leaf blushed and shot you a sorrowful stare.

You looked down at whatever remained of your PokeNav, now officially hopeless. How else could you prove your good faith to Leaf, now?

Your thoughts were interrupted when a large finger gently nestled itself between your chin and neck and pulled your head up, forcing you to look back at Leaf: she was smiling.

She guessed you wouldn't risk all the trouble of following her and making up the whole 'Mew' story for nothing; if you had any bad intentions, you certainly wouldn't have willingly gotten her attention, not when you were about two inches tall.

"Y-You... believe me?" you asked, not able to mask the anxiety you were feeling.

This time, Leaf spoke, for the first time since you got her attention,

"I suppose." she said. You recalled just how quiet she was, and yet she had a wonderful voice.

Still, it was no time to lose yourself over a pretty girl.

"And... s-so? Will you help me, please?" you asked.

Leaf's smile became slightly bigger, though not by much.

She offered another nod. It may have been a simple gesture, but it made you feel massively relieved, to the point you couldn't help yourself from shouting,

"Thank you, Leaf!"

In response, the smile of the teenage girl just grew a bit larger.

"You're welcome."
112321.title: Caught by Leaf

choices: To make you feel relaxed
To try and make you happy
To let you stay with her Pokemon as she gets ready for bed
1123212.content:
So this has turned out well you would say, Leaf seems to be helping you! You knew you could rely on her, or at least you hoped that way. Still you were glad this giant girl seemed to be nice. Moving down onto the bed, she sat down as she placed you in her palm. Letting you stand without much problem as she smiled at you.

Now Leaf has never been the most... social of people. It’s not that she disliked people, far from it though. It is just she is not the most talkative, or the most socially accepted. A good contrast with the loud Blue and the also silent Red.

Still she can talk, and she needs to know more. “So Mew wants you to follow her?”

“She wants me to go find her. Then and only then she will grow my size big. Or at least I hope she will. The thing is, I can’t make the journey myself. With how small I am, not to mention I don’t have any other Pokemon, don’t have much options.”

“obviously.” She said as that stung a bit, but she was being realistic. “Which is why you came to me, cause of my Pokemon?”

“Yeah, I saw your gym battle. I was back there and that’s actually when I realised I wanted to get your attention. You were so strong, and you know... as a trainer you will want to catch a legendary right?”

True, that was very true. However she was sort of doing her own thing at the moment. She looked down for a couple of seconds until she looked back at you. Determination in her eyes.

“Does it have to be instantly?” She questioned as you look at her confused. “You see, i’ve got six badges in this region, two away from a complete set. As you can understand, I want to do that.”

“Oh... okay I understand. Well, I guess drop me down and i’ll go find another trainer to ask. Pokecenter would be full of it.” You say a bit dejected, but thankfully she picked you back up.

“No, I will still help you, but it won’t be my primary objective. If you can accept that, I will be glad to go any Mew sightings on the way and try to help you.” She said as that was interesting offer. She wanted the badges, but it seems she will help you if need be.

“Well, that’s the best offer i’m going to get. If i’m being honest, I don’t even know where Mew would be. That Pokemon is a traveller right?” You question as she nodded. Leaf has heard stories about the Pokemon like you have. “So I guess, i’ll take your generous offer. Better than being by myself trying to track the legendary down.”

“Exactly.” She said smiling. You saw it her way. “Which means you get to stay with me.” Leaf said, a bit bigger smile on her face. Glad you were there.

“Chiko?” A voice said as you crane over. You completely forgotten about the Pokemon, the giant thing looking at you.

“Uh... hi?” You say as Leaf lowered you down closer to the curious Pokemon.

“Chikorita, this is (Your Name)” She said to her Pokemon. “He’s gonna be travelling with us, so treat him well.”

The grass type looked at you, a bit curious about you until finally she smiled. A big smile on her face as honestly... it did not calm you down. The smile seemed a bit... mischievous.

Seems like Leaf saw that as well. Grabbing the Pokemon’s own leaf and tugging it.

“Chi!”

“Not like that, if you think thoughts like that I will put you back in your Pokeball.”

“Chikorita!” It said panicking and jumping around as it broke free. You got to admit, it was kind of cute when you saw the giant Pokemon pout to you, moving away and back to the bed, laying down.

“Uh... young Pokemon?” You say as Leaf nods.

“Young and stubborn. She got free earlier today, spotting a Spearow or something. I had to chase her all around the city.”

“Uh yeah I know... I kind of saw it when I came in.” You say as she looks at you for a couple of seconds.

“Cool.” She said as monotone as possible, as you expected more from that. “Now, you lived in this city?”

“Uh yeah. Geez, what am I going to do, not like I can keep up with the bills.” You say to her thinking about real adult things.

“Don’t worry, I’m sure things will work out in the end.” She said as you had to assume. You don’t like thinking about it, and Leaf could see. moving her other hand down, she grabbed something from the bag, opening it up. “See, six badges.”

“Uh... yeah I can.” You say as you look over them, pretty impressed by her actions. “Wow.”

“I also have all of the Kanto badges. My team is on par with the elite four, and the best the gym leaders have to offer.”

“Wow, guess I made a good choice.” you say jokingly, although she didn’t laugh. Leaf did find it funny though. “Which two are you missing.”

“The ones from Blackthorn City and Goldenrod City.” She said as you blinked a couple of times at her. “I suppose you aren’t a trainer so you wouldn’t know.” She said giving you the benefit of the doubt, something needed. “The gym leaders there are Whitney, who uses Normal and Clair, who uses Dragon.”

“I hope Mew are at one of those towns.” You say as that seems to be the thing that was primarily on your mind. Still she can’t blame you, you were shrunken by the legendary and you want to get your height back.

Still, she can’t see running into Mew soon. If she gets the chance, she will leap for it, but she doesn’t see it happening. She looked down to you, as Leaf decided ________________
1123212.title: Discussing With Leaf

choices: Leaf let you sleep in bed with her
Leaf let you sleep in bed with her... Chikorita
Leaf put you to sleep in her bag
11232123.content:
Offering a small smile, Leaf looked over to Chikorita, who was still staring in your direction with repressed eagerness.

You needed to get things out of your head, and her Chikorita was going to be a great help with that.

"Chikorita." Leaf called quietly, causing her Pokemon to shift her gaze on her,
"I'm going to go get ready for bed. Keep our guest company in the meantime."

"Wait, wha-?" you said, surprised by what Leaf just said, but you had no time to protest; by the time the giantess placed you on the bed, Chikorita had already gotten on all fours and was crying her name happily in agreement.

"Have fun." Leaf said as she got up, heading to a door that led to a small bathroom, disappearing inside as she closed the door, leaving you behind with Chikorita.

Said grass-type wasted no time and leaped in your direction,

"Chiko!" she cried excitedly, not even giving you time to turn to face her as she laid down, bringing her paws around you, leaving you no way out of her 'embrace'.

"Chiko, chiko!" she kept saying, though you couldn't understand what she was actually saying.

You could only hazard a guess.

"Eh, yeah, it's nice to meet you too, Chikorita..." you said, not really sure whether that was the correct answer or not.

Whatever was the answer, Chikorita's smile widened as she leaned in closer. The air began carrying an overwhelming scent of fresh grass.

"Chi, chiko," the Pokemon spoke as she opened her mouth, her tongue slowly coming out as she gave you a couple of friendly licks.

Normally, you would have disliked it, but Chikorita's tongue tickled you, causing you to laugh uncontrollably.

"H-Hey, s-stop it!" you stammered, unable to keep yourself from laughing.

In response to that, Chikorita retracted her tongue in her mouth and grinned, before she brought the leaf on her head to you and began using it to keep tickling you.

"C-Chikorita, stop girl!" you yelled, but she didn't listen and kept going for about a minute more, until you felt that you had no more air left in your lungs.

Only then, the Pokemon giantess pulled back, wearing a smile on her verdant face, and sat by you while waiting for you to catch your breath.

It took a couple of minutes, but you were eventually able to stop laughing and retrieve your breath.

You stood up, shooting a glance and a smile in direction of the Pokemon.

"So I guess this means that you like me?"

In response, Chikorita's smile became mischievous again.

"How could I not like Leaf's cute little boyfriend..." she said, giggling to herself, perfectly aware that you had no idea what she was saying.

Good thing Leaf wasn't around to make the threat to return her to her pokeball into a reality.

She really hated it in that sphere. Not that it was uncomfortable or anything, but Chikorita was a free spirit who hated being confined within such a limited space.

"Ehh..." you said, unable to break through the language barrier.

Chikorita just giggled, her smile returning to a more friendly one.

"Ta." she simply said, waving a paw, telling you to not give it much thought. Then, she smirked once more,
"Chi."

"What does that mean?" you asked.

In response, the green Pokemon only let her grin widen.

She leaned in once more, then brought down the leaf on her head; somehow, you suddenly found yourself on laying on top of the leaf, before Chikorita flipped it, causing you to have a short flight, eventually landing on the back of the grass-type.

"Chiko!" she said as you readjusted yourself.

"Hey, what was that for?" you asked, but were completely ignored as the Pokemon began jumping around on the bed with you on her back; the result was that you looked like you were trying to hold on a Rapidash as it galloped around.

"C-Chikorita!" you called, trying to get the Pokemon to stop as you began feeling nauseous, although, despite dizzying, the ride on the grass-type's back was kind of... fun.

Chikorita knew that, and, young and stubborn like Leaf told she was, she had no intention of stopping. It was the exact opposite, she was about to spice things up, which she did when she took a great leap and jumped from the bed to the floor, skillfully landing on all fours while also nearly throwing you off of her back; you dug your hands in the soft skin of the Pokemon after that, not planning on becoming a red stain on the floor so shook after you managed to get help.

In elation, Chikorita began leaping around the room, truly acting like a Rapidash as she tried to throw you off while you hung on with all your strength.

At some point, you laid belly-down onto the back of the Pokemon and pressed your knees into it as well, hanging on as hard as you could; each time you felt that you were about to let go, you tightened your grip, not even bothering wasting your breath as you knew that it would be pointless: Chikorita wasn't going to stop until she willed it, or until Leaf came out and stopped her.

Luckily, Chikorita decided to stop on her own much much before Leaf came out of the bathroom; with one last jump, she leapt back on the bed and and flopped to the side, causing you slide off, marking the end of the ride.

"Ugh..." you moaned, feeling sick.

Chikorita got back onto her legs and strolled over to where you were laying, leaning to give you a couple of gentle licks.

You slowly sat back; Chikorita backed up and sat down by you, staring at you with a smile.

"Enjoyed the ride?" she asked in her own language.

You looked at her.

"That was... actually fun!" you said her.

It had been one thrilling ride, that was undeniable, but it had been pretty fun as well!

Chikorita's red eyes lit up.

"Chi~!" she cooed, leaning in, beginning to nuzzle you. You returned the display of affection by rubbing a hand onto her cheek, making the Pokemon give soft cries of approval.

Just then, the door to the bathroom opened, letting Leaf walk out; you noted that she had her light blue top off, and was now in a black, sleeveless shirt.

Immediately, the eyes of the teen locked on the sight of Chikorita coddling you, and a smile appeared on her face.

"You're done." you unnecessarily stated, getting a nod from Leaf, who walked towards the bed, picking you from Chikorita's attentions, much to the Pokemon's annoyance.

"Chii..."

"Enjoying yourself?" Leaf playfully teased.

"Hehe, yes."

Leaf let her smile grow a bit larger - she was so cute when she did that!

"Well, since I plan to resume the journey early tomorrow morning, it's time to go to sleep." Leaf explained, sitting on top of the bed.

"Okay, but where will I be sleeping then?" you wondered.

Leaf shot you another smile.
11232123.title: Chikorita cheering!

choices: She plays with you nicely
She plays withs you violently
She plays with you, treating you like a toy
112321232.content:
“You can sleep with me-”

“Rita!”

“And you can sleep with me too.” Leaf said with a smile down to her Pokemon as your eyes were shocked, a bit confused and even more.

“You let the Pokemon sleep with you?” You question and the answer was simple.

“Of course, she is still just young. Now, we are going to go to sleep right now.” She said simply, moving over and grabbing you. She grabbed you from the Pokemon’s back as she went over and began to relax.

Laying on the bed and getting comfy, now in nothing but a black top and black bottoms. Mainly because it was comfy, plus no one usually saw her in these. Guess she was going to change that with you.

“Chikorita!” Her Pokemon yelled, jumping up and getting close. Leaf was a bit confused about this. The grass type usually slept at the foot of the bed, guess it was different at the moment. Thinking for a couple of seconds, she pieced it together that it was you. Her Pokemon has really taken a liking to you, hopefully the rest will as well.

“So... how am I going to sleep, on the pillow?” You question, however looking at her Pokemon she has already decided she wanted to sleep with you. Taking a couple of steps back, you go to move but suddenly you feel yourself pulled around. Placed onto the bed as Leaf went under the blanket.

She lifted it high and her huge body went under, her head on the pillow as she seems so much more casual at the moment.

“‘Okay, guess I will just find whahh!” You got cut off as you feel a hand come and bring you around. Dragging you around with her power as you felt yourself pinned to something that you did not expect.

She held you, but what was pushing your back. It was soft, almost really. Confused about it, until you piece together.

“L-L-Leaf? Why are you hugging me against your chest.” You say really flustered about it. Behind you was her... boobs. It was actually boobs, not what you were expecting.

“I don’t want you to get cold,m” She said simply, and you were a bit shocked seeing that she was not embarrassed about it at all. In fact, she was more then welcoming to it. Which left you confused for obvious reasons. This girl sure was a strange one. “Not to mention, this is for my Pokemon.” She said and though you were confused, you could see the giant Pokemon looking down at you. Leaf opened her hands away from you, when suddenly you could see her Pokemon dive into them. You suddenly got what was happening, as she brought you closer to the hug, and in front of you was the giant stomach of Chikorita, the Pokemon feeling you against her as she wore a Poke smile compared to you. She held you for a long while as you look up.

“I feel like i’m in the middle of a sandwich.” You say to her as she Leaf smiled and you could hear her Pokemon giggle.

“You should be warm here. Goodnight.” Leaf said simply, as not only was she very direct, she was very caring. She is someone you really have to get use to.

“Chikorita!!” It said. You could see it’s giant head looking down to you happily as it was technically sleeping wit you.

“Uh goodnight Leaf. I guess, Goodnight Chikorita.”

“Goodnight little guy, I promise I’ll be the first thing you see when you wake up!” She said happily, as all three of you close your eyes. Right now, this was going to be fun and interesting, the unique step in your life.

-

When you woke up, it was because of feeling the pillow that was against you front go away. With a bit of confusion about it, you look around when suddenly... you could see a smiling face in front of you.

“Uh... good morning?” You say to the Pokemon. You can tell by the window, the sun was barely coming up. Why would the Pokemon wake you up, and why is her face so close.

“Hehehe, told you that i’d be the first one you see when you wake up,” Chikorita said, as of course you could not actually understand what she was saying. Not one bit. Although her intentions were really obvious.

She moved her body around and... well you learned that she knew Vine Whip, cause two of them come out of her sides.

She moved them to you, gently and smoothly lifted you up. Bringing you into the air and away from the grip of the trainer. Turning your head, you could see Leaf still sleeping on the bed, and you in the hand. The vines wrapped around you as she giggled.

“Ready to have some morning fun?” She questioned, as she moved down and got off the bed. Making sure not to wake her trainer at any point.

“Uh Chikorita?” You question for a long while as she moved down. She moved down to the ground and smiled. “Just... nothing too violent okay.” You say to her finally, as she brought you down. Her vine letting go as you see the giant leaf Pokemon looking down at you.
 She seemed very eager to play with you, but she still let you rub your eye and wake yourself up. Waking yourself up and getting up as you wear a smile on your face.

“Okay!” You say as suddenly she looked back. “Oh right quiet. Well i’m a bit awake now, so I guess i’m up for a little fun.”

It will help you rethink and not focus on the... problem at the moment.

“Okay, well i’m really excited, and when I woke up you were the first thing that came into my mind. We have to make sure we don’t wake my trainer up though. Anyway, let’s play!”

You didn’t understand any of that, but it was clear what was happening.
112321232.title: Letting You Sleep With The Trainer And Pokemon

choices: Leaf let you join her as she got ready
Leaf let you stay with another one of her Pokemon as she got ready
Leaf actually decided to have a little fun with you herself first
1123212322.content:
After all, you could tell by that way Chikorita was staring at you that she was up to no good; after all, that devious smirk she was carrying could mean nothing too good...

"Ehh... Chikorita, I'd like you to remind that I'm really fragile, and that Leaf would probably be upset if you hurt me..." you said, hoping that the green Pokemon would simply leave you alone, no matter if you had to humiliate yourself to achieve such goal: your safety came before your pride in this situation.

In response, Chikorita's smirk went from mischievous to smug.

"I'll keep that in mind. However, it's not like I'll hurt you..." she cried, before her smirk went back to being mischievous,
"That is, if you can run fast enough."

"Uhh..."

"Chiko, chiko!" Chikorita said, her vines one more emerging from the sides of her neck,
"You have five seconds before I put these bad boys to use!"

For good measure, the towering Pokemon began whipping the ground extremely near where you were standing, causing you to jump out of the way.

"Chi-" a second whip to the floor made you jump back, and a third caused you to turn tail and start running from the Pokemon as fast as your tiny legs could go.

Shortly after, you felt the ground begins to thump under your very feet as you heard the familiar cry of an overexcited Chikorita chasing you.

In response to that, you sped up while shooting a desperate glance in direction of Leaf, who was still sleeping in bed.

You had no choice.

"LE-"

"Oh no, you don't!"

Another Vine Whip hit the floor next to you, cutting your cry for help short.

Terrified, you switched direction and began running to another side of the room, with Chikorita emulating you.

You didn't know what to do.

The Pokemon giantess was certainly gaining ground, and you were going to be powerless to stop her sudden burst of mischief once she reached you.

Didn't she like you just yesterday!? Just what had gotten into Chikorita!?

Out of options, you just kept running, with Chikorita's vines occasionally hitting the floor near you, each time threatening to give you a heart attack, yet Chikorita herself seemed to have no interest in catching you, seemingly more keen on enjoying her little game of cat and mouse.

Eventually though, you began 'running' out of breath and started slowing down. Something Chikorita picked up on, and wasn't really fond of.

"Aw, c'mon you Slowpoke! Try to at least make this a little challenging for me!" she cried, once more extending her vines, this time actually hitting you, not strong enough to hurt you, but definitely enough to make you feel a jolt of pain that made you sprint faster a second time.

It one or two more times, and you were fairly sure that your shirt was now ripped open, you could tell as you felt cold on your burning back... which was actually a relief.

This couldn't go on, you had to come up with something, fast... and you did, once you saw where you were headed: the bed Leaf was sleeping in.

Without thinking twice, you sprinted as fast as you could and jumped under the bed to escape Chikorita.

"Aw, come on! No fair!" she cried as she reached the bed, making a poor attempt to get underneath as well.

Sadly - and luckily for you - she was too big to slide under.

"Chikoooo..." she cried in annoyance, before remembering about her vines; if she could just slide those under the bed, she could get you and could keep playing!

"Chi, chiko!" the grass-type laughed mischievously as she peeked under the bed where you were hiding.

You saw her red eye staring at you, but you knew she couldn't reach you, which filled you with relief... at least, until she began sliding one of her vines in, letting it snake its way towards you.

"Peek-a-b-ko!"

The vine stopped dead in its tracks, then retreated.

Chikorita disappeared from sight, replaced by the more reassuring sight of a hazel eye which you recognized as Leaf's.

Relieved beyond belief, you slowly made your way out of your hiding spot, where an awake and very annoyed-looking giantess was waiting, holding Chikorita by the leaf on top of her head; you stood by the Leaf's bare feet, watching as Chikorita desperately tried to break free from her grip.

You repressed the urge to laugh at her, who was getting the Pokemon version of an earful.

Instead, you turned your attention to Leaf.

"G-Good morning, Leaf," you greeted, before looking away, embarrassed,
"Thanks for the save."

Finally, Leaf let go of Chikorita, who scampered away, and bent down, offering you a hand to climb on; once you did, the giantess rose back and, smiling reassuringly, began stroking your back with a finger.

"Sorry for that." she murmured, as quiet as ever,
"I guess it was my mistake."

"N-No! It wasn't, just... what's gotten into her?" you wondered.

Leaf exhaled, annoyed.

"She likes chasing small things, like yesterday's Spearow." she explained,
"Sorry for the trouble."

"... It's okay, I guess..."

It was not okay, it was all but okay: your back was stinging like hell!

Leaf smiled sorrowfully, then cheerfully,

"Well, now that I'm up, it's time I go get ready. I... we have a journey to continue," she said, as quiet as ever,
"And as for you-"

"Don't leave me with Chikorita!" you quickly shouted.

"Chiik..." the Pokemon spoke from a corner in the room, looking much like a kid after being scolded by their mother, which was basically what just happened.

Leaf shot a brief glare in direction of her Pokemon, then looked back at you and nodded.

Still, she couldn't just leave you sitting around, especially not with Chikorita. Not anymore, anyway.

Luckily, Leaf was quick to think of a solution.
1123212322.title: Rough-housing

choices: She cuddled you with her tail
She swings you around like a rollacaster
Something else?
11232123222.content:
Leaf smiled as she thought of a good idea. Heading over to her bag, with you still in her hand you watch as she grabs a Pokeball. Holding it as you question.

“Are you going to call Chikorita back?”

“No, i’m just giving her a babysitter.” She said simply as she threw the Pokeball. It opened up and you saw a Pokemon come out of the light and materialise itself. Looking to the Pokemon, it was unmistakable what it was.

Yellow with red highlights, a regal position, on all fours and most importantly, Nine tails.

“Uh... okay?” You say as the Pokemon stretched out of the Pokeball, Chikorita being just as confused.

Leaf learned her way forward and placed you right onto the ground in front of the giant fire Pokemon. Her eyes instantly locked onto you, a little bit shocked.

“I got to get ready, Ninetails, can you look after my little friend and make sure Chikorita is nowhere near him.” Leaf said as the Pokemon looked up from you.

“Uh... Leaf, I don’t think this is-”

“Ninetails.” The Pokemon interrupted you, very loudly as you look to it, then back to Leaf.

“Don’t worry, she’s a good Pokemon,” Leaf murmured. You don’t know if that was because she just woke up, or that is how she usually is. “Good luck.”

Leaf walked and went to the bathroom, closing it behind you as you look to the fellow human leave. The shower turning on soon after that and then... a sound behind you. It sounded kind of like a purr, or whatever the fox equilivent is.

Turning around, you could see Ninetails, smiling down at you. It’s tail up and dancing behind her. Even from this scary angle, she really looked majestic. You have never seen one so up close before.

She didn’t say anything, but instead Ninetails brought her paw over you, and you knew what was going to happen. She brought it down slowly on you, as she pinned down. Smiling as she held the little human tight under her paw.

It wasn’t uncomfortable, but clearly it was to keep you under her paw and make sure you weren’t going to run.

Why would Leaf thinking leaving you alone with two Pokemon would be better than one.

-

And well, it was. Ninetails was one of the first couple of Pokemon Leaf got, back when she was a Vulpix. Hence there was a strong bond between the two. She trusts Ninetails and for good reason. While she has her paw on you, she wasn’t going to try anything besides that.

“A little human, how curious?” Ninetails said with a smile, “This is so odd?”

“Mew shrunk him down.” Chikorita picked up moving away from the tails. “He’s gonna be travelling with us now!”

“Is he now? Well, I like that.” She said, her toothy grin down to you.

“Hehe, Me too. Ninetails, I want to play with him too!” Chikorita said moving her way in, but the Pokemon got blocked as a couple of tails got in her way.

“Leaf wants me to make sure you don’t play with him, and I will. You just sit over there and watch.”

“H-Hey no fair!” Chikorita complained, only to get a chuckle from the other Pokemon. “You’re playing with him!”

“Leaf didn’t say anything about me playing with him, just you. You can try to... take him from me. If you are feeling bored enough?” She questioned, daring the grass type to do anything.

“Fine, whatever he likes me more.” Chikorita said not even going down that route. Not only is Ninetails evolved and a stronger Pokemon, she also had the type advantage.

“We will see if he still feels that way, after i’ve had my fun with him.” Ninetails said her eyes back down onto you.

-

You rest under the paw, watching the entire interaction. So Ninetails is protecting you, it does seem that way as she shooed Chikorita away. Plus her paw, while on you was not hurting you.

“Nine?” She questioned, as you had your eyes opened due to suddenly being talked to.

“Uh... hello?” You say as she smiled down. Slowly but surely, the Pokemon brought it’s head down to you, or more accurately it’s nose. It came right for you and you let the nose not only poke your chest, but sniff you as well.

“Ninetails.” She said, a grin on her mouth as she seems to like the way you smell. Which is really weird, cause you haven’t taking a shower since yesterday morning. Before the events with Mew.

Eventually she raised her paw off of you, as you feel fine at the moment. Slowly getting up, until finally, you feel something else coming for you.

It was one of her tails, as it came for you and wrapped around you. You raised your arms as you feel a soft tail envelope you and soon enough grab you. Lifting you into the air and high above the ground.

“W-Woah!” You say as you feel the tail move, bringing you close to the Ninetail’s smirk. Okay, so this Pokemon is playful, and seems to really like you.

However she hasn’t hurt you yet, and if anything is going out of it’s way to not to. Also seems to be a bit of a tease, as she turned her head to Chikorita, the Pokemon pouting and angry in the corner as she wanted to have fun with you.

Still, this Pokemon wasn’t so bad.

“C-Careful Ninetails, just in case you... actually this feels pretty soft.” You say feeling her tail as she smirked even more.

“Well look at that, he likes me more already.”

“No he doesn’t!” Chikorita said, as maybe she shouldn’t of been so violent towards you. Now half mad about herself for doing it. That was a dumb move.

As for Ninetails, she took her glance back to you and finally has decided what she was going to do with you and your small body.
11232123222.title: Bringing Out The Fox

choices: "... Goldenrod City. They say the gym leader there is super tough."
"... Blackthorn City. It's a bit far, but we might find Mew on the way..."
Leaf was interrupted - Jasmine was heading her way!
112321232221.content:
Still trapped beneath the vixen's soft, warm paw, you couldn't see very well, but you could hear Ninetales and Chikorita speaking to each other.

You wondered how hearing was of any use to you right now, since you couldn't understand them anyway, not being able to understand their intentions; it was tantamount to them speaking normally while you were deaf.

However, the situation soon changed, when Ninetales finally removed her paw from your body, allowing you to see her face; her red were carrying a friendly glint in them while a smile had taken place on her muzzle, though that didn't reassure you: Chikorita had already proved that smiling that way meant nothing, and if Leaf's Ninetales was anything like the younger Pokemon, then you probably better start worrying.

Ninetales saw that you were still staring at her warily, so she turned to Chikorita and shot her a smirk.

"Watch this." she said; Chikorita puffed out a cheek, pouting.

Ninetales was like a big sister to her, but a big sister that loved teasing. Plus, she was very loyal to Leaf, so if Leaf gave specific orders not to let Chikorita play with you, then Chikorita herself wasn't going to lay a single paw on you until Ninetales wasn't called back to her Pokeball.

Growling to herself, Chikorita turned away from Ninetales, a blush on her face.

Ninetales turned back to you, gave a soft cry of her name and fully removed her paw from before sitting in front of you.

"Uh... thanks?" you said, grateful but not still willing to let your guard down.

In response, Ninetales gave a soft, reassuring cry of her name, before you noted that her tails were wiggling behind her back.

It wasn't long before one of them extended towards you; now, you were no Pokemon Professor, but you had read that a Ninetales had a certain ability to place a curse on anyone stupid enough to touch their tails.

And those tails were about to touch YOU right now!

"Eek!" you yelled, jumping back,
"You're trying to curse me!"

The tail stopped in mid-air for a second; the golden-furred Pokemon blinked twice, before she let out a chuckle.

"Don't be silly." she barked, the tail resuming its descent towards you.

You jumped back once more, only to bump into a fluffy, warm wall; looking back, you noted that the wall you had bumped was just another one of the several tails of Ninetales, which you had just touched.

Your body froze up as terror settled it, but the Pokemon only laughed as she wrapped the same tail you bumped into around your body and lifted it off the ground, letting you lay on it as if it was a beanbag chair. A large beanbag chair.

"U-Uh?" you stammered, noticing that nothing was happening; if anything, you were just put somewhere a hundredfold comfier than the under-paw of Ninetales.

"I just thought I'd give you a more comfortable place to lay on than the floor, sweetie," she cooed, or rather purred, moving her tail around so that it looked like a couch.

You said nothing, and resisted the urge to give the tail a hug. It was so smooth! It felt like laying on a warm cloud that was laying on top of another cloud!

Ninetales smirked briefly - Chikorita was probably busy biting her leaf off at this point.

"Nine, Nine-tales," she spoke, sounding just as soothing as her trainer was.

You almost felt like going to sleep again, after Chikorita had woken you up so early in the morning; you nearly gave in to the temptation, but made a great effort to stay awake.

Two more tails joined you, one landing on top of you and the other joining the one that was already under you, forming an ocean of fur you couldn't hope to swim out of.

"So... warm..." you muttered, hypnotized by the warmth the Pokemon emitted and by the smoothness of her fur.

Ninetales chuckled and glanced at Chikorita with a look that screamed triumphantly, 'He's mine'.

"Chikoo!" the grass-type cried, annoyed, rushing towards Ninetales, who merely moved the remaining six tails to form a barrier that kept Chikorita from reaching her.

"Tut tut." the Fox Pokemon said,
"Nine."

With a groan, Chikorita once more walked away, a sour look on her face.

Ninetales simply smiled.

Then, for some time, there was complete silence in the room, until Leaf came out of the bathroom, fully dressed and ready to go.

However, seeing her two Pokemon and not you made the trainer look at Ninetales with a curious expression, only to offer a relived smile when the vulpine parted two of her tails, revealing you laying on the third.

"Good job, girl," Leaf said while leaning in to pick you with a hand, using the other to pet her Pokemon on top of her head and under her chin, causing her to growl happily in approval.

After that, Leaf called the Pokemon back in her Pokeball, not before she had given you one last smile though; then, the brunette headed over the bed, grabbed her bag and hat and put them on, instructing Chikorita to follow as she walked out of the room.

Leaf eventually got back to the lobby of the Pokemon Center, where she paid her rent for the night to the Nurse before leaving; the sun of Olivine City showered both you, her and Chikorita, the sound of the tranquil sea filling the ears of the three of you.

"What a nice day," you commented, before looking down,
"Perfect for a beach day."

You struggled not to think about Leaf wearing a bikini.

The same Leaf just giggled to herself in response.

"So... where are you going next?" you wondered, before letting out a sigh,
"Or, I guess, where are WE going next..."

The giantess brought two fingers to your back and began petting, much like she did before.

"Well, we're going to..."
112321232221.title: Fluffy embrace

choices: A wild Pokemon!
Another trainer
A Tauros from the nearby Ranch
1123212322211.content:
“Goldenrod City. Funny enough I have never actually been there.” You say with a laugh as she held you up. Really close to her face.

“Neither have I,” She said, even though you two were close she was not really being loud. Showing how quiet she was use to. “The Gym Leader there i’ve heard uses Normal Types. So I will be going there first. If we see Mew along the way, we of course will detour, however that’s the plan.”

“Well honestly, that’s all I can hope for.” You say wearing a smile back to her. She headed around and walked outside, her fingers covering you as she didn’t want you to get seen in the Pokecenter. After handing the key back to Nurse Joy and getting all her things in order, she began to leave. She even recalled Chikorita, as a bit of punishment for playing with you before

She left and walked away with you going through the door. It was going to take a day of travel. If she didn’t get sidetracked she could make it before night, however as a Pokemon Trainer, sidetracks are very prominent. Walking back up to where Mew shrunk you, she plans to go up.

You were stuck in her fingers for a long while, as she made sure to not only hold you but make sure you were safe.

She got to the edge of the city, and as the number of people went down she started to pull you out. Pulling you out and placing you on her shoulder.

She let you sit there as you could see the giant world above you.

“Thanks, so we’re finally going now.” You say to her as she shifted her eye around and looked at you in the corner.

“Don’t fall.” She warned as you appreciated. “We are, the Route for Goldenrod requires me to move through Ecruteak City, and then down to Goldenrod.” She said giving you the plan.

“Cool, I guess i’ll be on the lookout for Mew.” You say to her, as she can’t help but frown a bit. She doesn’t see this legendary showing us as even a real chance. Still you were being hopeful, which of course was a good thing.

As she walked for a little bit more you commented. “Hey, that’s where I got shrunk.” You say pointing to the place you were sleeping. “Can we check it out?”

Leaf looked at you, seeing it as a little detour. She listened and she got moving, heading over. “Why would you just sleep in the wild?”

“Well it’s near the city, so I didn’t think much of it. I know, i’m pretty stupid.” You say as she can’t argue about it. Moving and going away, she walked away.

“There’s nothing there, let’s just keep going. I want to get to Goldenrod before dark.”

You go with her because... well you don’t really have a choice in the matter. She was taking you around.

You two walk for a little bit more in silence, until you had to speak out.

“So uh... how are you planning on facing the Gym Leader?” You say to her, figuring you should start up at a type of conversation.

“Well, it’s a normal gym and I don’t have any fighting Pokemon on my team, so of course using type advantage won’t work. She will want to use her strongest Pokemon considering how many badges i’ve got.”

“Wait her?”

“Her name is Whitney.” She said as you try to recall any info about her.

“Oh yeah her... i’ve think i’ve heard her in passing. She’s the Goldenrod one.”

“Yes,” Leaf said about to show you that she has done her research. “There has been a lot of stories about her stubborn and childish she is, so that could be annoying.”

“Y-Yeah.” You say thinking about a girl described as that. Would be more than trouble for you.

“As for strategy, I will just bring in my strong Pokemon and overpower her. Although her Milktank could be trouble. Blastoise should be able to outlast that Milktank though.”

“Right... Blastoise. I saw it the other day, was it your first Pokemon?” You question as she did get a smile about it.

“He was my first one, back when he was just a Squirtle. He’s grown with me, and I wouldn’t have most of my badges without him.” Leaf said with a smile as you can’t help but wear a smile.

“Well, now I know three of your Pokemon. Speaking of which... your Chikorita, I-”

“She’s only like that because she likes you.” Leaf said. “Don’t worry, After this punishment i’m sure she will be more careful with you.”

“T-That’s good I guess.” You say back to her with a smile. Now far into the route connecting the two cities you ask her more. “So what other Pokemon do you have?”

“I actually have a lot more, to the point where my PC is pretty full.” Leaf said with a smile. “I have a Sandshrew, a Pigeot, A Ditto, A Doduo-”

“Well what Pokemon do you have on you?” You question even more just wanting to know. She looked at you for a couple of seconds.

“Well I have only four on me, just in case I need to catch some more. There is Chikorita, Blastoise, Ninetails and-”

She didn’t finish that, as you both heard a sound.

She turned her head, while you got a bit scared and hugged her neck. A little bit frightened, but given your size it made sense.

“W-What was that?” You question just wanting to be sure. Moving your eye around and looking over to Leaf. She was prepared, grabbing her Pokeball and ready to toss it.

It could be a trainer looking for a battle, it could be a Wild Pokemon she could honestly catch. Regardless, she was going to show you her fourth Pokemon she was carrying.

As she looked to the sound, she saw that it was ____________
1123212322211.title: Moving With Leaf

choices: The trip to Goldenrod City was uneventful
Something happened along the way
11232123222112.content:
And a trainer it was, much to Leaf's amusement. Judging by the way he was dressed, he appeared to be one of those bug-catchers she couldn't get enough of beating back in Kanto, and even here in Johto, they kept 'bugging' her.

Leaf giggled at her own lame joke.

"Hey, you! My Pokemon evolved just recently, so let's have a battle and put it to the test!" the other trainer said.
